item.title: Authentication Browser Storage Options
item.description: Before the invention of client side rendering and AJAX, there were web apps that required visiting multiple pages. To keep the auth data in the browser for navigating to other pages, cookies were invented. Even with single page apps, browser storage is important to allow a user to remain authenticated …
item.dc:creator: Jessie Anderson

item.title: Authentication Cases You Could Handle
item.description: Authentication is a big job at the start of building a web application. These days, there are a lot of options on how to do it. The technical implementation and possibly 3rd party service you choose can depend on what use cases you want to support. This is the start …

item.title: Github Search Users
item.description:
• Search for Github users and view some profile details, utilizing Github's REST API V3
  • Serverless React app
  • Styled with Material-UI
  • 'Concurrent Mode' with debounce to reduce fetching and rendering with React hooks
  • Technologies: React, Axios, Material-UI

Live Github

item.title: Confirm Destruction Modal
item.description:
Confirmation modal for users to reduce accidental destruction. Uses React, Reactstrap, and Font Awesome.

item.title: Sprite Viewer
item.description:
Given an image composed of sprites evenly spaced with the same dimensions, slide through viewing individual sprites. Uses ES6, HTML5 Canvas, and JQuery-UI Slider.

item.title: FlightBookr
item.description:
• Flask backend provides API to Backbone.js from a JSON file of flight information

  • Marionette managed composite views and events
  • Technologies: Flask, Flask-Assets, Backbone.js, Marionette, Foundation, Parsely, Syphon, Momentjs, JST templates, Jinja2, HTML, CSS

item.title: Python's Dictionary Get
item.description: In a Python dictionary, one way to return the value for a specific key is a_dictionary[key]. Another way is to use the get method: a_dictionary.get(key). The difference is when the key is not in the dictionary. The bracket method returns an error, but the get method is …

item.title: Bcrypt with Rails
item.description: Bcrypt is an algorithm for hashing passwords that can be implemented in many programming languages. When a user signs up or logs in, the password they entered is sent to the server. SSL should be used for this stage, but that is separate from bcrypt. Bcrypt's job is to protect …

item.description: Strings, lists, tuples, integers, float, dictionaries, and sets are all types of python objects with different properties and uses. item.title: 2010 Guess The Number Game
item.description: During my first month of learning python, I wrote a game to guess a number between 1 and 20 with six attempts. This simple game is good practice for a beginner. A better written and more advanced version can be found at http://housewifehacker.com/intermediate-guess-number-python-game.html. This example is …
item.dc:creator: Jessie Anderson

item.title: Decimal to Change Number Precision
item.description:
The built in math functions in Python use binary approximations, giving some funky results when dealing with numbers containing decimals:

>>> .1 + .2
0.30000000000000004
>>> round(100.00 / 3.000, 4)
33.333300000000001

One way to appropriately find the sum of decimals is to use strings

>>> str(.1 + .2)
'0.3 …
item.dc:creator: Jessie Anderson

item.title: Map Function in Python
item.description:
Today I discovered the map function in Python. Map causes some simple for loops to be verbose and unnecessary. Let's look at how to change a list of integers to a list of strings. First we'll use a for loop:

>>> list = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
>>> index = 0
>>> for x …
